text: Saad Tedjar (born January 14, 1986 in Béjaïa) is an Algerian footballer who is currently playing for ASO Chlef in the Algerian Ligue Professionnelle 1. ==Club career== In 2006, Tedjar signed a five-year contract with Paradou AC. ===JS Kabylie=== In June 2009, Tedjar was loaned out by his club to JS Kabylie for one season with a buy option at the end of the loan period, on condition that Paradou AC do not gain promotion. In his first season with the club, Tedjar scored 3 goals in 23 games as JSK finished third in the league. On June 4, 2010, JS Kabylie took up the buy option on Tedjar, and the player signed a two-year contract with the club.JSK : Aoudia prolonge d’une année et Tedjar de deux ans On August 29, 2010, he scored a goal against Egypt's Al Ahly in the 2010 CAF Champions League group stage, helping his side become the first team to earn a semi-final spot after drawing 1-1. ==International career== On April 18, 2010, Tedjar made his debut for the Algeria A' national team as a substitute in an African Championship of Nations qualifier against Libya.EN A' : Les Verts qualifiés sur le fil pour le CHAN 2011 ! On August 12, 2011, Tedjar was called up for the first time to the Algerian National Team by Vahid Halilhodžić for a 2012 Africa Cup Nations qualifier against Tanzania.EN : Les 25 pour Tanzanie - Algérie ==Honours== * Won the Algerian Cup twice with JS Kabylie in 2011 and USM Alger in 2013 ==References== ==External links== * * Category:1986 births Category:Living people Category:Footballers from Béjaïa Category:Algerian footballers Category:Algeria A' international footballers Category:Algeria international footballers Category:Algerian Ligue Professionnelle 1 players Category:JS Kabylie players Category:Paradou AC players Category:USM Alger players Category:ASO Chlef players Category:Kabyle people Category:2013 Africa Cup of Nations players Category:Association football midfielders
title: Saad Tedjar
